Ron Paul announces possible Republican 2012 presidential bid | World news | The Guardian
 
 
Ron Paul announces possible Republican 2012 presidential bid
 
 Long-time Texas politician and Tea Party favourite has made a key step on the official route to the White House
 
 
 Ron Paul, a libertarian-leaning Republican congressman beloved of many Tea Party supporters, has announced he is exploring a 2012 presidential bid.
 
 The move is a key step on the official route towards announcing a final candidacy and thrusts the long-time Texas politician into a Republican field that has been more marked by hesitancy than any apparent fervent desire to take on Barack Obama.

 
 This will make me vote republican.

Ahh Good old (and I mean OLD) Ronnie. This man doesn't know XXXX about foreign policy.

Ahh Good old (and I mean OLD) Ronnie. This man doesn't know XXXX about foreign policy.

 
 Yes. He does. He knows that if we are directly responsible for the death and oppression of millions of arabs, we should not be surprised when they show up XXXXXX and blow some of us up. 
 
 He supports a policy of non intervention...avoiding entangling alliances...something that every one of our founding fathers supported whole heartedly. 
 
 Frankly, given what I have heard on his foreign policy views and what I have heard of yours, you have your statement backward. Pauls foreign policy views are based on facts and constitutional principals. Yours tend to based entirely on ignorance and misinformation. 
 
 Which of his foreign policies do you oppose???
 
 BTW....did you know that Ronald Reagan was a big supporter of Pauls views on foreign policy? Look for "The Ron Paul Story" on youtube. 
 
 I know it is hard to believe, but spending hundreds of billions of dollars interfering in the affairs of other nations, especially the internal affairs, is NOT a conservative principal. It never has been.

 I agree. Ron Paul is a man who not only understands the constitution, but actually follows it. Look at his voting record, it speaks for itself. People have been too quick in the past to write Ron Paul off as a dried up old coot. Paul is an intelligent and principled man who makes a lot of sense if you actually listen to him. I have not voted in a presidential election in years, but I will support Ron Paul 100%.
